intro: Cyathea oreites, commonly known as the Philippine tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant has a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 10 meters in optimal conditions. Its rhizomes are thick and fibrous, providing structural support and aiding in nutrient absorption. Cyathea oreites plays an important ecological role in tropical rainforests, contributing to biodiversity and soil stability.
